items.title: Gaza's few remaining Christians praying for 'peace' this Christmas
items.description: The small number of Christians remaining in Gaza have marked Christmas early with subdued celebrations in the shadow of ongoing conflict and occupation.

items.title: US and Ukraine reach consensus on key issues to end war with Russia
items.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said that Ukraine has reached consensus with the US on key issues to end the war with Russia but sensitive issues around territorial control, along with the management of a nuclear power plant, still remain unresolved.

items.title: These men fled Ukraine, but found a Europe far less welcoming
items.description: Since Russia launched its full-scale invasion in 2022 thousands of men have fled Ukraine. Once welcomed, they are increasingly finding a Europe that is running out of patience.

items.title: Tourist cut holiday short after alleged attack on Melbourne pier
items.description: Police are searching for a group of up to eight people allegedly involved in an assault last Thursday, which left a Norwegian tourist with a broken arm and facial injuries.

items.title: Perth man pledged support for Bondi shooters hours after attack, court hears
items.description: Police found a bomb-making shopping list when they searched the home of a man who allegedly posted on social media that he supported the gunmen behind the Bondi terror attack, a Perth court has heard.

items.title: Island residents brace for Christmas cyclone as rain and wind bears down
items.description: Residents on a remote Indian Ocean Territory are bunkering down and scrapping Christmas plans as Tropical Cyclone Grant approaches.

items.title: This couple is on opposite sides of the political divide. Here's how they make it work
items.description: More Australian relationships are struggling because of political divides. But experts say this does not have to be the end.

items.title: Honouring a late mate a driving force for She's Sydney to Hobart campaign
items.description: A fellowship of sailors will embark on She's 23rd Sydney to Hobart campaign. As they do they will honour one of the most resilient boats in the race's history and remember late owner Peter Rodgers.

items.title: Stokes defends teammates as Archer's Ashes ends
items.description: England's disastrous Ashes tour has received another blow with Jofra Archer ruled out of the remaining two Tests while skipper Ben Stokes has dug in to defend his beleaguered team.

items.title: 'Aussie' poster in Adelaide vandalised with 'white power' graffiti
items.description: An Adelaide street artist's poster aimed at provoking thought about national identity has been vandalised with racist graffiti.

items.title: $1.2 billion Hamilton Island sale labelled 'extraordinary'
items.description: An American equity firm plans to purchase the jewel of the Whitsundays.

items.title: Celebrating with chosen family and local community quells holiday blues
items.description: Despite our screens being filled with images of happy families celebrating Christmas, some feel the festive season is lonelier than ever.

items.title: Budget travellers turn to public transport to get home for Christmas
items.description: Budget-conscious travellers are turning to long-haul trips on public transport to get home for Christmas, but overcrowding and delays in the regions can cause headaches.

items.title: What you need to know before you buy lab-grown versus natural diamonds
items.description: Diamonds are generally considered a luxury asset that holds its value, but the emergence of laboratory-grown diamonds in the jewellery industry over recent years could challenge that belief.

items.title: Second-hand fashion is big business, but is it helping the planet?
items.description: The rising popularity of second-hand and vintage fashion has been viewed as an opportunity to reduce fast fashion consumption; however, Australia remains one of the world's highest waste producers.

items.title: Quiz: How well do you know traditional Christmas carols?
items.description: Do you know your Merry Gentlemen from you Three Kings? Your Dancers from your Prancers?

items.title: Brendan Fraser makes the case for human connection in Rental Family
items.description: Academy Award-winner Brendan Fraser speaks to ABC News about his new film and why human connection is the antidote to an increasingly polarised world.

items.title: Four years ago today, the future of astronomy was sitting on top of a rocket
items.description: Since its launch on Christmas Day 2021, the James Webb Space Telescope has stunned astronomers and delighted the world.

items.title: Epstein files email show 'A' at 'Balmoral' sought 'inappropriate friends'
items.description: Someone who referred to themselves as "A" at "Balmoral" emailed convicted child sex offender Ghislaine Maxwell in 2001, asking if she had found them "some new inappropriate friends", the latest Epstein files document dump has revealed.

items.title: 'Fake' note about Trump in Epstein files, Justice Department says
items.description: The US government says newly released documents from the Epstein files contain "untrue and sensationalist" claims about Donald Trump.

items.title: Young motorcyclist issues warning after life-changing crash
items.description: Liam Ganter does not remember the crash that nearly killed him, but he is living with the consequences, and hopes his story will stop others making the same mistake.

items.title: US sanctions five Europeans involved in regulating tech companies
items.description: Leaders in Germany, France, Spain and the European Union slam the move as "intimidation and coercion".

items.title: Girl found unresponsive in water at Perth beach after being caught in rip
items.description: A 12-year-old girl is in a critical condition after a surfer pulled her unresponsive from the water at Trigg Beach on Tuesday.

items.title: '$10,000 worth of Louis Vuitton' stolen in alleged home invasion
items.description: Two armed offenders allegedly forced the occupant of a house north of Hobart to open a safe, escaping with about $10,000 worth of Louis Vuitton items, police say.

items.title: Low-income adults and kids in jail denied lawyers over Christmas
items.description: Legal Aid NT pauses all grants of aid for December, meaning people in the territory held in custody over Christmas — including children — will not have access to a legal aid lawyer.
